data.name: Pseudo-Psy Play
data.detailed_description:
Pseudo-Psy Play is an eccentric blend of a side-scrolling shooter and a point-and-click quest. The time has come ‚Äì face your fears in this bone-chilling story-driven horror adventure that feels (and looks) like nothing else in the genre.

There is no escape.

It is your Pseudo-Psy Play.

Joseph hums a song that sounds surprisingly familiar to him. With a smooth movement of the hand, he turns on the tap; cold water burns Joseph's skin, but despite this, he continues to wash his hands. Anyway, before he can finish, the water suddenly stops running, and the residue of the frozen soap settles on Joseph's hands and sleeves, shrouding them like a dirty gray blanket. He finally raises his eyes and gazes blindly into the mirror.

Joseph: *sighs* What the‚Ä¶? Rose? Is this really happening?

That's how Pseudo-Psy Play started. And what will happen next is only up to you.

PSEUDO-PSY FEATURES:


"The United States of America ‚Äì Home of beautiful Nature!"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is happening right here and right now. In this play, our modern world is the stage where the story unfolds;



"I guess I should have said this in Introduction, but anyway, now it‚Äôs too late"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is a play. Innovative storytelling methods: only in Pseudo-Psy Play rooms can speak. As Joseph, you will make your way through the House and relive many terrifying episodes from Rose Underwood's life;

"Is This Really Happening?"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play stands for a Pseudo-Psychological Play. A fresh look at the psychological horror genre: an intuitive combat system will allow you not to only run away from enemies, but also to fight them;

‚ÄúMonsters‚Ä¶ They are real, Joseph‚Äù
  • In the twisted, surreal world of Pseudo-Psy Play monsters are real. And if you want to survive, you should treat every one of them in a completely different way;



‚ÄúHow could this be?‚Ä¶‚Äù
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is open to dialogue with the player. Pseudo-Psy Play considers multiple factors (such as the language you speak and your playstyle) to create unique, personalized experience. It is YOUR Pseudo-Psy Play;

‚ÄúIt is my Pseudo-Psy Play‚Ä¶‚Äù
  • Pseudo-Psy Play has an ace in the hole. Use the power of tarot cards to gain an advantage over the horrifying enemy. But be careful ‚Äì as you know advantages and disadvantages always go hand in hand, so choose wisely;

"Freakin‚Äô awesome!"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is portrayed by professional actors. Starring Jeff Garris, Jessica Fisher, Jessica Jacobs, Chad Shirley and Fiona Audron;


"I don't know what to think anymore"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play does not limit itself to only one visual style or genre. An odd mix of side-scrolling and point-n-click genres that you‚Äôve never seen before;

"I should be ready to face it"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is a chamber play. But this doesn't mean that you can't just stop and explore its beautiful world full of an unexpected surprises;

"But this time it‚Äôs‚Ä¶ Different"
  • Pseudo-Psy Play is an experience. The hand-drawn interactive cutscenes will stuck in the hallways of your mind for a very long time...

What will your Pseudo-Psy Play be?

Play A Play.

data.short_description: Pseudo-Psy Play is an eccentric blend of side-scrolling shooter and point-and-click quest. The time has come ‚Äì face your fears in this bone-chilling story-driven horror adventure that feels (and looks) like nothing else in the genre. Are you ready, Joseph?

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 or Later
  • Processor: Intel Core‚Ñ¢ Duo or faster
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics
  • Additional Notes: For the better Pseudo-Psy Play‚Ñ¢ experience please connect your Xbox One gamepad before starting the game
